Read files for the Connector_fs class

cnt_read.Connector_fs.Rd

Read files for the Connector_fs class

Usage

# S3 method for class 'Connector_fs'
cnt_read(connector_object, name, ...)

Arguments

connector_object

A Connector_fs object

name

Name of the file to read

...

Other parameters to pass to the read_file function (depends on the extension of a file)

Examples

connector <- Connector_fs$new(tempdir())
connector$write(iris, "iris.csv")
connector$read("iris.csv")
#> Rows: 150 Columns: 5
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (1): Species
#> dbl (4): Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> # A tibble: 150 × 5
#>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
#>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa 
#>  4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa 
#>  5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa 
#>  7          4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3 setosa 
#>  8          5           3.4          1.5         0.2 setosa 
#>  9          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1 setosa 
#> # ℹ 140 more rows
connector$remove("iris.csv")
